processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was transferred from the Rare Book Division on 18 March 1987.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: In a letter, [1855?] December 2, "Clinton Place," to John W. Francis, Duyckinck sends a copy of Volume I, The Cyclopedia of American Literature,returns several borrowed items and asks that Napoleon signatures be given to autograph collector Samuel [Francis?]. With the letter is an undated pencil and charcoal drawing of a dog initialed "G. B. M." [possibly George Barr McCutcheon].

did.unittitle: Evert Duyckinck to John W. Francis 2 December 18[55?]

scopecontent.p: Evert Duyckinck sends a cloth copy of volume one of The Cyclopedia of American Literature, returns several borrowed items, and asks that Francis hand the Napoleon signatures over to the autograph collector [Samuel].
Drawing of a dog, intitialed "G.B.M" (possibly Geroge Barr McCutheon) and accompanied by the compliments card of Henry W. Sweeney.
